Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Families”
Reviews.Author: Lamada
Reviews.Content: We were on a family weekend trip to SeaWorld and Mission San Luis Rey. I got an unbelievable rate on-line and decided to stay here between the two locations. The hotel was very clean and roomy enough for the adults and grandkids. We always love the breakfast at the Best Western and it saves on time when you are traveling. We ate at the Asian restaurant across the street that was recommended by the front desk. It was an excellent meal. I would recommend this hotel to any family.

Reviews.Title: “Review Best Western San Diego/Miramar”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and the staff was wonderful!! The breakfast was everything needed to start the day !!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: I will never stay here again! I booked a room (with occupancy 4) (2 weeks in advance) through priceline. I called to confirm the reservation, and that we would have a room with 2 beds. Once checked in, we were put in a room with 1 bed, for 4 people. And then told that they saw a request for 2 beds, but if I wanted 2 beds I had to pay an additional $20 plus tax. I requested to speak with a supervisor, because I know they cannot put 4 people in a room with 1 bed. The person working the desk refused to contact a supervisor. I ended up paying the additional money, only because I had prepaid the room through priceline and could not walk away without losing my money. I paid more than what an average night would have cost, and the hotel was definitely not worth the price. Another good thing to know, breakfast ends at 9AM, not 10AM. Myself and everyone else who thought it ended at 10AM were treated so rudely when we showed up for breakfast a little before 9.

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: Amyhstr_12
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler you get accustom to average. So on the rare occasions that you come across excellence I just get giddy.  Best Western Miramar is just that AWESOME. Its like being at home.  The hotel (Holiday Inn) across the street bills at 229.00 a night on average and is a drop in the bucket compared to this establishment.  Best Wester is nice, clean and a bargain.  You have a small studio like room with a sofa and refrigerator/microwave in every room. The people make the place Jimmy at the front counter and Mr. Patel make my day every time I check in.  I have stayed in 100's of hotels and this one is one of my favorites.  For the service, for the amenities but mostly for the people.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of 2012”
Reviews.Author: Shayne W
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal all around USA and other countries. This Hotel was truly refreshing and great value for money. The staff were all awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Jharu
Reviews.Content: This is our regular hotel for when my family is in the San Diego area. Has been for a couple years now. I go to college in san diego so whenever they visit me, we stay here. It's clean and pretty well kept. The staff is friendly and will do their best to fix any problems you may have with the rooms. For the price it's definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Miramar-Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dan R
Reviews.Content: A very nice, clean hotel, very well located for my business as a traveling auditor. Good internet connection, clean rooms, comfortable sleeping. I have stayed at this hotel at different times 6 times and have never had any problems. I highly recommend, the hotel staff is helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fact vs. Fiction-this is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pmac123
Reviews.Content: I am an avid user of TripAdvisor and have used it many times over the years to ascertain where to stay on my many trips around the world. My recent trip to the Best Western Plus in Miramar has finally got me off my rear end to write a review rather than just merely reading of the experiences of others... The reviews of this hotel were mixed with many complaining about issues which, quite frankly, appeared to be either ridiculous or petty. The room I have here is spotlessly clean, with modern amenities, a much larger refrigerator than your typical dorm room sized unit, lightning quick free internet access, a large work desk and a comfortable firm bed with fluffy pillows and more towels than I could use even on a longer trip. Am I saying that the other reviewers of this hotel were being picky or wrong? Not necessarily but perhaps people feel it necessary or important to show how what made their visit less than perfect....for $82.00 a night including tax I had a free breakfast, comfortable safe room and a kind friendly and attentive staff to make my visit enjoyable. Is it the Fairmont or the Ritz? Not by any means but it is far superior, in my humble opinion and personal experience, than the reviews I read of this hotel. If I ever come into the Miramar area again, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel....at a reasonable price I received much more value than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Friendly Motel”
Reviews.Author: dandev724
Reviews.Content: I have found this motel to be very neat and clean with comfortable surounding and a friendly helpful staff for the last five years.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jude m
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old and just off the main road which concerned me. It turned out to be very clean and quiet with a very friendly staff. Conveniently located with a very convient price. Good place to stay If you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, need I say more?”
Reviews.Author: Nia C
Reviews.Content: We thought we would save a few bucks and stay at a Best Western when visiting San Diego.... boy, was that a mistake!! We stayed two nights in June 2011. I saw an odd bug in the bathroom and thought it was a baby roach. I didn't report it to the front desk because it was the only bug I saw. Yes, stupid move. Two weeks later, I had to call an exterminator because I had major pest problems. When the exterminator showed me the pests... they were the same type of bug that I saw at this hotel. Well, long story made short, staying at this hotel to save a few bucks ended up costing me $1500 in pest control costs. I called the hotel to inform them of the fact there were bedbugs at the hotel and that they needed to exterminate. Manu referred me to Jason, the "guest relations" manager. Jason was rude and dismissive.He even told me that they have NEVER had a bedbug problem....Jason should check out the July 2011 review!! Maybe having multiple reviews that tell about bedbugs experiences at this hotel, will give management the incentive to take care of their bedbug problem!! I will never stay at a Best Western because of my experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 days”
Reviews.Author: Paul R
Reviews.Content: Had a great Stay at this hotel. I read the reviews and was a bit concerned with them but gave the hotel the opportunity to show me and they did. The staff was very helpful and I know that all hotels need your cc just in case damage is done or items are taken from the hotel. Room was spacious and very clean and service was completed on the room everyday. I did noticed that a few more outlets would have been nice. We both have cell phones and camera that require an outlet to charge every day. For the price we paid the room was very good. All in all we did enjoyed our stay for the 4 days we stayed there and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience..”
Reviews.Author: sayswai
Reviews.Content: There were more cons than pros for the 4 nights that my family stayed here. 14 people were on this trip and we rented 3 rooms. Unfortunately, the room that i ended up with had many problems. All 3 rooms were non-smoking room, but right when i walked into the room, you can smell the aroma of cigarettes. The second problem faced was the dysfunctional microwave in the room. We called the front desk to come fix it for us, they were nice enough to come see what was wrong with it and come fix it; however, i don't know what they fixed because the microwave did not heat up the food at all. The third, but biggest, problem was the BED BUGS! Even though they might say their hotel is bug free, we faced these little pests late at night. My son was bitten many times(pictures included) and I was bit once on my eyebrow on the last night. Luckily, we caught one bug that was still moving around in the morning and showed them to the front desk. We asked for a discount because all the nights we stayed there were met with discomfort; however the best they did for us was a discount for one night. We called the manager and explained our situations after our stay and he wasn't much of a help either.

Reviews.Title: “Just an okay hotel but red flags initially everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: nikki1123
Reviews.Content: First, some things that us question our choice: We arrived for a long stay around 10pm on a Friday and the lobby main door was locked... we had to use a bullet proof "night window" to check in (like a bank would have in a not so nice part of town). After feigning hearing issues with her behind glass, I asked to be let in the lobby and was let in and saw security camera monitors were pointed at every possible corner of the grounds. We got a room on the 3rd floor and the automatic door facing the hall to the rooms was broken. We had to walk all the way around the outside. We get to the elevator and its "down for maintenance". I went back into the lobby and asked for a first floor room or second floor at least and she gave us one. When we got in the room though we were pleasantly surprised. The room looked updated for the most part with a nice granite counter outside the bathroom, counter height refrigerator and microwave. Horrible outdated tv though and ours had a loud screeching sound until it got warmed up. Bathroom was unbearably small. You had to step in and go behind the toilet to close the door. Outlets were lacking too. My husband and I both use our cell phones as alarms and want to plug in our phones next to the bed but there were not outlets anywhere near it. I had to unplug a lamp on the other side of the room. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Breakfast was blah but I wasn't expecting much from continental. Lo and behold, something else was broken! There are two Belgian waffle makers and one was out of order so we waited a very long time for our turn. Cereal, pastries, toast, coffee, etc. Every piece of fruit I got was a little past prime. Nothing to rave about. Overall, for the money, great deal and adequate for short hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “EXTORTION....DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: davidmyers01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really a dump. Upon check in, the manager threatened to cancel my reservation and not offer a refund for the prepaid hotel room charges unless I allowed him to charge my credit card for $50 to be applied against "incidentals". I requested that no services be turned on for my room that would result in such charges and he, once again, threatned to prevent me from checking in. This is extortion, false advertising and a total rip off. Avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: SafetyRory
Reviews.Content: Pillows Pillows...great room great price, great staff...

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: KenVC_11
Reviews.Content: As several others have posted, this hotel is a scam. If you book through Hotwire, Priceline etc. you will only get a handicap, smoking room. I love the way the manager responds when these type of complaints are posted as HE DON'T CARE!!! They have been doing this a long time. If you want a non smoking room you pay 10-15 dollars more. I had Hotwire ban this hotel from my searches as I stay in this area 8-10 times a year.

Reviews.Title: “SCAMMER's”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel81
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation in June and cancelled the reservation at least 2 weeks in advance of our reservation. The hotel charged my credit card indicating that I did not cancel the hotel room. This was absolutely false. I cancelled the room and gave them plenty of notice. stay away from this unethical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for...”
Reviews.Author: TRM60
Reviews.Content: We paid $113 plus tax for our room on a Friday. This hotel is about 15 minutes from downtown San Diego. Other hotels closer to San Diego were $140 plus tax and up on this particular day. For those who don't live in California remember that the sales tax and other convenience charges will be in the 13% range. We ended up paying $129 for a $113 bill. Some complain of the traffic noise as this hotel is next to a highway. We hardly noticed it as we were exhausted from our busy day in San Diego. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were awesome. After getting the password for the wi-fi connection we used the internet to our hearts content. As I got my first batch of ice I noticed that the pool was pretty crowded. We don't go on vacations for the pool, but it sure looked like the pool was enjoyed by the families and kids who were there. We usually grab something to munch on for breakfast, but slept in on Saturday and by 9 am the breakfast room was packed. We grabbed a muffin and found our way to Little Italy's farmers market where we got a pretty good panini sandwich for breakfast. I think some people are having trouble with bookings mainly because of Expedia and Hotwire. If anyone takes the time to read the other reviewers, most had trouble with their reservations because they made them though a secondary company. The hotel didn't get a "5" mainly because the breakfast room was a bit small for the complex, and the ice machine close to our room was broken. We had to go to the 3rd floor for the ice we needed. I also think that San Diego in general is a bit expensive. The hotel was full and as good business people they charge what they can. A previous reviewer mentioned that he did not want to use his Hilton points. Folks... this is not a Hilton hotel. I'm sure the "Del Coronado" is a better hotel. As I'm sure that Motel 6 would have been cheaper. We got a good value from this place.

Reviews.Title: “suspicious booking and smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: Goniochromist
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Priceline and when I checked in had the excat same situation as another guest who has written a poor review here. I was given a smoking room which had NOT been requested only to be offered a NON SMOKING room if I was prepared to pay another additional $15!!!!....this hotel is scamming individuals to rack up additional charges to increase the room rate.... I recommend all who consider this location to avoid it like the plague!...It has left a bitter taste in my mouth NEVER to use Best Western again

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DaddysOwn
Reviews.Content: I was visiting my son and daughter in the Del Mar area of San Diego. I wanted a clean, quiet room and property with a microwave and fridge in the room, a pool, complimentary breakfast, with a computer center for guests to use, and close to my son's house. I got all this and a warm treatment from the management and the hotel staff. I stayed there 3 nights and enjoyed a quiet comfortable sleep each night, although there was a large contingency of teenage guests in town for tournaments as well as graduation guests, and complete families as well. I asked for a quiet room and got a 3rd floor room. The only sounds I heard were from the Top Gun pilots overhead in their planes doing night training occasionally, but the efficient air conditioner drowned out all but the loudest sounds form those jets. The whole property seemed clean and freshly painted, my room with two queen beds was well appointed and comfortable, the breakfast (continental) was sufficient and plentiful. One elevator brought you up to each floor. The only concern someone might have is that the rooms all open out onto an outside entrance or walkway to stairs outside - no internal hallways - so some might have a concern for security...but my impression of the neighborhood was that all was safe and secure and no worries from that standpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Minklechicken
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 weeks staying in different hotels almost every night and must say I think Best Western hotels are very good and affordable. This one was great, we asked for quiet room and got a lovely quiet room on the inside. I loved the fact we had a fridge and microwave in the room and basic breakfast was free. I found staff lovely and helpful, location ssuited us as we did not want to stay in Gaslamp district due to noise, there is a lovely beach near. Only thing I would say was below par was intyernet connection, which was attrociously slow but then again, it was free so who can argue. decor was decent and we had comfortable bedding. Nowhere to eat if you don't fancy fast food nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: I had to travel for a class in San Diego on May 6, 2010, so I decided to fly down the night before and stay near my destination. I booked this hotel through Hotels.com and found the reservation method easy and secure. Upon arrival, I found the hotel to be above average for a Best Western. The room was large, clean, and well equipped. It had one of the more comfortable beds I've encountered. Checkin was fast and easy, the staff was pleasant, and breakfast was served on-time. The only down-side was the traffic noise from the road to the west, so I would recommend not taking a west facing room.

Reviews.Title: “running a scam; beware”
Reviews.Author: nordica1950
Reviews.Content: I had booked a reservation through Priceline.com for a non-smoking room. When I arrived at the hotel I was informed succinctly that my reservation came through for a smoking room. Although there were non-smoking rooms available, I was charged $11 to change to a non-smoking room. Calls from customer service agents at Priceline had no effect at all. The front desk clerk admitted to me that this happens very frequently (every day she said) to people who book through Priceline or Hotwire. I believe this hotel is running a scam to earn extra revenue by charging unsuspecting customers extra money for non-smoking rooms. Shameful. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “More than worth for the money we paid.”
Reviews.Author: UtahAggie
Reviews.Content: Before visting the hotel, I was bit nervous how the hotel is going to be. Once we got there, we realized how beautiful and clean the hotel room is. The staff is incredible. I would recommend this hotel to my friends or family anytime they are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “This place is perfectly kept, clean, and convenient, and the people are kind.”
Reviews.Author: jkallin
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here occasionally over the last few years, I've witnessed their constant work keeping the building updated and clean. The rooms are always quiet and comfortable, (great shower too). The manager and his staff are personable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: AnaheimRobt
Reviews.Content: A no problem hotel. Good clean rooms, nice breakfast. A little pricey though.

Reviews.Title: “it was great”
Reviews.Author: magali182
Reviews.Content: The room was really nice, enough facilities, friendly manager and a good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: phoenixfox1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel which was reasonably priced for the area. It has 2 restaurants within walking distance. The room was clean and well maintained. Wireless internet was easy to access.

Reviews.Title: “Superb customer service provided by Mr. Patel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Densta
Reviews.Content: My family and I recieved superb customer service from Mr. Patel and staff. We will be happy to recommend this particular hotel to our friends and other family members visiting the San Diego area...without a doubt! We wish to thank the parties concerned for their care, warmt, and professional attitudes in the service recieved...g-thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: teggy01
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, friendly staff. Rooms are very new looking. Nice breakfast in the mornings. Room service is great, the maids are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with comfortable beds...adequate but unmemorable.”
Reviews.Author: Leonardsworth
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a nightmare due to a computer system being down and thus the clerk being unable to issue a key-card. They need to have a backup system in place as it was very annoying to stand around for 20 minutes while the clerk talked to computer tech support on the phone. The rooms itself are very clean, fairly spacious, and with a good, high-quality mattress. Bedding is decent and new. I did not try the continental breakfast due to time considerations. Nice big pool and jacuzzi. Seems a little expensive for what it is...a mid-range room.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS San Diego / Miramar Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 9310 Kearny Mesa Road, San Diego, CA 92126
